page.title: 17MEDIA..NEWSPAPER REPORT
page.content: {FIFE HERALD,Friday 7th.June 1985 The following report reflects the importance of farming in our area. Enviromental issues connected with farming are in the news these days. "Parliament debates pesticides" "All eyes are on the House of Commons as the Food and Enviroment Protection Bill enters the last stages of its passage through Parliament. Part of the Bill relates to pesticides as the Govt. seeks support for a Pesticide Safety Precautions Scheme. For the past 27 years the scheme has given Britain an excellent record of safe use. There have been no fatal accidents due to pesticide usage in farming for more than a decade and less than 0.5% of the 4000 non-fatal accidents to British farmworkers each year are attributable to pesticides.
